docs.lead_paragraph: MEETING OF EXEMPT FIREMEN.--The exempt Firemen of this City held a meeting at Firemen's Hall, in Henry-street, last Wednesday evening, to take the preliminary steps towards organizing them selves into a Society similar to others now in existence in some of the principal cities of the United States-for benevolent purposes.

headline.main: Original Letter of John Adams.; From the Boston Transcript.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEAR SIR: I have received your favor of the 24th, and it revived or restored many of the sensations of my youth. The last trial before a Special Court of Vice Admiralty in Boston, before the Revolution, was of ANSEL NICHOLSON, for Piracy and Murder on the high seas.

docs.lead_paragraph: FROM NASSAU, N. P.--The Bahama Legislature met at Nassau on the 22d ult. The Message of the Governor presented a rather favorable view of the Colony. The Governor says he has entertained, and frequently expressed to the legislative bodies, an earnest desire to promote the advent to that Colony of valetudinarians, and their families, from Canada and the United States.

headline.main: THE SOUTH.; Letters on the Productions, Industry, and Resources of the Southern States. NUMBER FIVE. Holidays with Slaves... Pocket Money....A Conversation between Slaves... Slaves in Tobacco Factories ...How they get Money...Overwork...Story of a Cunning Slave...Slaves in Cotton Factories...Improvidence of Negroes...Are they Improving?...Education...Religious Privileges...A Slave Preacher...Contentment...Laws of Louisiana...Food, Lodging, and Clothing of Slaves. To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: From Christmas to New-Years' Day, the Slaves (except the house servants,) enjoy a freedom of labor; and Christmas is especially holiday, or Saturnalia, with them. The young ones began last night firing crackers, and I do not observe that they are engaged in any other amusement to-day; the older ones are generally getting drunk, and making business for the police.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: GENTLEMEN: Your kind note, which was handed me last evening, was as unexpected as it was gratifying. While I cannot flatter my self which the idea that I am justly entitled to all the praise which your friendship has s generously bestowed, I am frank to confess that I do feel a consciousness that I have spared no pains to merit it. Of this, however, you are the best judges.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEW ARMORY.--We noticed last week that efforts were being made to have a new Armory for the military, erected in place of the old dilapidated building at the corner of Henry and Middaghstreets, now used for that purpose.
